Name: Shabti
Description: Faience shabti, glaze lost, with pick and hoe held to the chest, basket strung over left shoulder, and long beard and wig-lappets, is typical of such figures in the Late Period. The lines of hieroglyphic text over the front, now barely legible, give 'chapter 6' of the Book of the Dead, in which the figure is summoned to do any hard labour on behalf of the deceased in the afterlife.
